formalText: She is having trouble with fear of germs and fear of intruders coming to attack her family.
She feels that if she doesn't do certain things each day that bad things will happen to her.
She feels like she  needs to wash her hands constantly.
Every time she touches something that someone else may have touched such as door knob light switch for a faucet handle.
Then she is afraid that she will get get germs that could cause her to get sick.
She has fears that she forget to lock the door turn off the lights.
She finds this happening so much that she is late for her job in the morning on her way to work.
She has to turn around and drive home to see if she remembered to turn off the coffee pot.
She feels fear and discomfort is she doesn't do these things over and over.
She wakes up anxious during the night and sometimes she must check things in the house like the Windows Doors coffee pot and lights in the garage and closet.
She has always been particular about things but this is really taking over her life.
These things affect her life her job relationships with your husband kids friends.
She can't resist the feeling that something bad will happen just overwhelms her.
She felt the need to count and wash her hands more often after her mom died.
She was depressed and felt so low, but she didn't attempt suicide after her mom's death.
She has three kids.
The oldest is eight, the middle of 6, and the youngest is 4 year old is and is just starting to mimic how she uses a paper towel to open things.
Her mother was a very neat and kept person.
Her dad was a Salesman and was well kept but not more than other people.
Her siblings are brother and sister are messier than she is.
